Dear Mr. Goggint
I m very happy to inform you officially that the Board of Directors of the
HAEB has approved your application in behalf of Station KETG for active
membership in our association#
You will now be receiving regularly from us the monthly HAE3 newsletter, var¬
ious additional publications of interest as they are published, and many
other items# You should, of course, feel free to write to us at any time
for aiiy information you would like concerning educational broadcasting#
will always try to help.
Enclosed you will find a list of the materials available from the NAE3.
Please let us know which of these you would like to receive and we will send
them to you#
Also enclosed is an announcement of the HASH fall convention and announcements
of workshops and fellowships now available. Under separate cover we are
sending you the last three newsletters and several other items of interest#
Your certificate of membership will be sent you soon.
Perhaps the greatest good of an MAEB membership is the associations you form#
It*s good to know that others are having the same problems you are and how
they are solving them# It has been the tradition with IUE3, in its thirty
years as the association of educators who broadcast, to exchange this sort
of information on a friend-to-frlend basis# ^ou will find lots of friends
in HAEB, and lots of people with good advice and good staff resources to
supplement those which you have#
Sincerely,
